title: YouTube Autoplay Prevention Implementation
content:
Implemented YouTube autoplay prevention for Quick Tabs feature in v1.6.1.5.

Solution: Multi-layered defense-in-depth approach
1. URL Parameter Control: Added _processUrlForAutoplay() method in QuickTabWindow class that detects YouTube URLs (youtube.com or youtu.be) and adds/sets &autoplay=0 parameter
2. Iframe Allow Attribute: Added 'allow' attribute with 'picture-in-picture; fullscreen' (explicitly excluding autoplay permission)
3. Maintained existing sandbox attribute for security

Implementation Details:
- File: src/features/quick-tabs/window.js
- Method: _processUrlForAutoplay(url) - safely parses URL and sets autoplay=0
- Iframe creation updated to use processed URL
- Error handling: Returns original URL if processing fails

Why This Works:
- YouTube respects &autoplay=0 parameter for both /watch and /embed URLs
- Browser 'allow' attribute without autoplay blocks cross-origin autoplay
- Defense-in-depth: Both mechanisms work independently
- Firefox enforces allow attribute restrictions

Tested: All 2212 unit/integration tests pass
ESLint: Clean (only pre-existing max-lines-per-function warning)

Cross-Tab Impact: Fix applies to all Quick Tab instances across all tabs due to URL being stored in state and processed during render() call.
